definition: to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: "From each according to his ability, to each according to his need" is a fundamentally good idea.
sentences.chinese: 各盡所能，按需分配從根本上說是個不錯的主意。

sentences.english: The principle that the government or charity organization abides by is to distribute according to need.
sentences.chinese: 政府或慈善機構實行的原則是按需分配。

sentences.english: The flexibility of cloud computing is a function of the allocation of resources on demand.
sentences.chinese: 雲計算的靈活性在於能夠按需分配資源。

sentences.english: All hospital beds should be allocated on the basis of need.
sentences.chinese: 所有醫院牀位都應該按需分配。

sentences.english: Memory is allocated on demand based on the database workload.
sentences.chinese: 基於數據庫工作負荷按需分配內存。

definition: to distribute/to assign/to allocate/to partition (a hard drive)
to nationalize/to take over as communal property
each does his utmost (idiom)/from each according to his means
